With each movement Johnny could feel the power coiled up in Jack's muscular body, the feeling of his massive body expanding with each breath was downright intoxicating. He felt incredible! He literally felt incredible, he thought, as his hands drifted across Jack's form feeling his big muscles. The rush of hormones and emotions he was feeling was causing a reaction from Jack's penis, and while he didn't want to look at it in front of his brother it felt... heavy.

"Stop feeling me up dude! That's gay." Jack stormed over to his brother and tried to slap his own hands away from his body. Instinctively, Johnny moved to block him, and they both stared in shock as Johnny used his new muscles to effortlessly stop Jack's assault.

"Sorry it's just... God, this is so cool, isn't it?" Johnny grinned as Jack yanked his arm away from him. He wasn't used to being the strong one!

"Cool for you maybe! You got an upgrade! Meanwhile I'm stuck in this schlubby body. Get me out now." Jack was pissed, but he had no power in this situation. He was smaller, weaker, younger, and didn't know enough about the machine to switch them back. He had just lost everything and he was feeling a little scared as he stared at his own handsome face, which was staring thoughtfully into the distance.

Johnny was conflicted. On the one hand Johnny was honestly kind of freaked out. This wasn't what his machine was for, so he was in uncharted waters here. He didn't know if it was safe to switch them back, or if there would be side effects to the switch, or any number of problems that occurred to his super intelligent mind.

But on the other hand, this was kind of amazing! Hadn't he just been wishing that he could experience life as a tall, handsome jock like his brother? This was his chance! Plus perhaps a few days in his admittedly less impressive body would humble Jack a little.He subtly squeezed his new bicep and marveled at how huge it was. He could have a lot of fun with this body, and he'd never have a better chance with Cerise as he did right now.

Oh no, Cerise would be over soon! He had to make a decision before she arrived. What would he do?
14411.title: Body-Jacked

144113.content:
Jack opened his mouth to speak, but before he could say anything, there was a knock at the door.

"Hey, it's me." Johnny recognized that voice. It was Cerise! "Are you guys in there?"

"Cerise!" Johnny squeaked with Jack's deep voice. He called out meekly. "Y-yes, we're inside!"

Cerise perked up as she heard Jack's baritone rumble from behind the door. She'd always thought men with deep voices were sexy. "Would you mind opening the door for me?" She asked as sweetly as possible. "It's locked."

"Yeah, just, give us a second." Johnny's words were cut short as Jack leapt up and slammed his hand over his brother's mouth, shushing him. He didn't like that he had to stand on his toes to do so, and he liked even less that Johnny was able to push him away so effortlessly. Those were his muscles, damn it!

"Dude, we can't let her in here!" He whispered angrily to Johnny. "We have to fix this."

"I don't know if I can fix this right now and I can't just leave her standing out there!"

"Well then tell her to go away!"

"No!" Johnny cried, a little too loudly. He blushed self-consciously at how much power his new pipes had and lowered his voice again. "She's a guest, Jack. It would be rude."

"Johnny I think that us being in the wrong bodies is a little more important than your fucking schoolboy crush." Jack couldn't believe how crazy his brother was acting. He didn't want to spend any more time in his brother's scrawny body than he needed to, and he especially didn't need an audience.

Johnny knew Jack was right, the situation was crazy and potentially dangerous. He couldn't meet Cerise looking like this! Or... could he? He felt his cock stir in his pants as he thought about it, as if to remind him of the impressive tool he now had at his disposal. Suddenly it all clicked into place for him. "Well..."

"Well what?"

"Well tough!" Johnny snapped. "It's my machine, I'm the bigger brother now, and I say we let her in. What are you gonna do about it?"

The two glared at each other, each daring the other to back down. This had been a familiar scene in the Mack household growing up, the two boys at odds with each other. Jack as the much bigger brother had always won, of course, but the tables were turned now. His biggest advantage (and everything else big about him) had been transferred over to his brother, who was quite literally flexing his power (and muscles!) for the first time in his life.

"Alright." Jack said finally. Johnny grinned. It felt good to be the big man! "Then we need a plan."

"You're right. What do we do Jack? What do we tell her when she comes in?" Johnny looked to his big brother, who had planted himself at his desk with a pouty expression. Johnny made a mental note to never do that once he was back in his body because it looked ridiculous.

"Don't ask me! You're in charge now, right?" Jack rolled his eyes. Johnny had picked a really bad time to stand up for himself, and if he wanted to call the shots, fine! Jack wasn't gonna make it easy for him.

Johnny considered the situation. He wasn't sure if he could effectively pretend to be Jack. Looks would only take him so far, and Johnny knew he was still his awkward self underneath all of the muscle, and no matter how big his dick was he knew he was awful at talking to girls. He knew that with the handsome visage of his brother his chances with Cerise would skyrocket, but Cerise might still think he was a freak. He could tell her up front about his new device/what it had done and hope that she'd be impressed, or he could pretend to be Jack and hedge his bets that way.

And, of course, there were Jack's feelings to consider. Could he trust Jack not to embarrass him using his own body?
144113.title: Too late! Cerise is here.

1441132.content:
Jack sighed when they agreed to tell Cerise the truth "Fine, we'll tell her, but only because I don't want her thinking I'm a dork. You're not cool enough to pretend to be me."

Johnny opened the door to the shack and let Cerise in "H... hi Cerise... c... come in!" Johhny blushed as he stuttered. Jack was right. He was still a dork even in Jack's body.

"Are you OK Jack? You seem flustered!" Cerise said concerned.

Jack rolled his eyes "We've swapped bodies! Johnny's latest invention malfunctioned and we're stuck like this until the dork can fix it!"

Cerise gasped in shock. She had no reason to think the brothers were lying. Johnny was the smartest person she knew. Cerise also planned to take advantage of the situation. She always had a thing for Jack, or more accurately his body. But he wasn't interested, Jack had a lot of options. Cerise knew Johnny had a crush on her and she'd NEVER date such a dork normally, but in Jack's body he'd be putty in her hands.

"Johnny this is amazing! I've always said you were the smartest person I ever met. And I kinda have a thing for smart guys!" Cerise lied, only one thing on her mind and that was Jack's body. Cerise got up close to Johnny and put her hand on his rock hard abs causing him to blush.

"Hey you two! Stop that right now!" Jack shouted from his scrawny body. He was not happy how close Cerise and Johnny were getting.

Cerise sneared at Jack "Oh shut up! You should be proud of your little brother. This invention of his could make your family rich!"

Jack had had enough "That's it! I'm telling mom what you've done! You're dead meat!" Jack then ran out of the shack and back to the house.

Now that Jack was gone Cerise, her hand still on Johnny's new abs kissed Johhny on the lips. Johhny blushed.

"Aww you're so cute Johnny!" Cerise teased.

Johnny blushed even harder "I... I should really f... f... fix the machine!"

Cerise then lowered her hand to the impressive bulge that now belonged to Johnny and began to massage it sensually. "What's the rush? Jack never deserved that body. I think you should keep it a bit longer. You can fix the machine after we've had some fun!"

Johnny's eyes just went wide with fear... and anticipation.

**************


Jack had finally found his mom Carla cooking in the kitchen.

"Mom. You've got to come to the shack right now!" Jack yelled.

"Will you calm down Johnny! I'll come out in a minute when dinner is in the oven!" Carla snapped.

"But mom! I'm not Johnny. I'm Jack. Johnny's latest invention went wrong and we swapped bodies!"

Carla wasn't surprised, she knew her son would finally invent something useful. Something she could use for herself.

Carla raised and eyebrow interested "Really?! That's amazing!"

Jack was not happy with his mom's reaction "Mom! Johnny's in my body and he's in the shack alone with Cerise!"

Carla giggled "Oh chill out Jack! Let your brother have some fun for a change!"

Jack was not happy, Carla was already thinking about finding a 'volunteer' to swap with and Johnny was about to have the time of his life with Cerise.
1441132.title: "We'll tell her what's going on."

choices: A pod from one of his experiments
1441133.content:
As Johnny tried to think, another sharp knock came at the door. "Hello?" Cerise called from outside. "This better not have been some kind of joke."

"All right here's the plan." Johnny said. "You don't want me to ruin your reputation, I don't want you to ruin mine. So I'll hide, you'll pretend to be me and deal with Cerise." Jack began to protest but Johnny quickly silenced him with a hand over his mouth. He could get used to being the bigger brother! "This way nobody has to know my machine broke and nobody has to see me as you. Everybody wins! Then I'll switch us back once she's gone."

Johnny removed his hand from Jack's mouth, prompting his older brother to hiss "I don't even know how to work the machine!" at him.

"Apparently I didn't either!" Johnny said. "Don't actually do anything, just fake it. Fiddle with the buttons, throw some technical jargon out there, act like it didn't work, tell her to come back later. You're a Mack, improvise."

"Don't play that 'you're a Mack' card on me," Jack snapped. "For a 'genius' this is a pretty dumb plan."

"You'll do it or else I'll dress your body up in a tutu and parade it through town square." Johnny threatened.

Jack's eyes narrowed. "You wouldn't dare."

"I wonder how you'd look in pink." Johnny rose up onto his tip toes and stick his hands in the air in a dramatic mock-ballet pose. The sight of his body, the muscular paragon of masculinity, en pointe, was bizarre. "Picture it with a ribbon in your hair."

Johnny and Jack shared a few seconds of heated eye contact. Jack was beyond irritated with his little brother, but at the same time, it was growing increasingly apparent that Johnny held all the cards here. He was relying on Johnny to fix this gizmo to get his body back, and he didn't want Johnny messing up his personal and professional life. Plus... maybe it wouldn't hurt to give Johnny a little bit of help with Cerise. In spite of how annoying he was being Johnny was a decent kid, and maybe some female attention would help him act a bit more normal. Even if he was working with Johnny's considerably more limited goods (he'd have to have a talk with Johnny about the benefits of cardio once they switched back) the old Jack Mack charm had worked on many a girl before, and he was confident he could get some kind of spark going.

"Fine," Jack grumbled, rolling his eyes as Johnny did a fist pump. "But for the record, my ass would look great in tights."

"Thank you so much!" Johnny yanked his old body off the ground and into a hug. Jack rolled his eyes, but couldn't keep himself from grinning a little bit. Setting Jack back on the ground, Johnny took off running towards the back of the shack, his flailing limbs even managing to make Jack's otherwise gracefully athletic body look awkward. He paused.

"Oh and Jack." Johny towards Jack, who rolled his neck and looked exasperatedly back at his (now older) brother. "If you embarrass me in front of Cerise, I'll get a neck tattoo." Jack blanched and nodded.

Smiling the nastiest grin he'd ever smiled, Johnny opened a door and ducked into...
1441133.title: Fake It 'Til You Make It

14411332.content:
Johnny slipped out into the backyard and against the back door of the shed. If he leaned in close he would be able to hear everything that happened in there (fortunately he had never gotten around to soundproofing the shed like his parents begged him to) and he could peek in through the window if need be. If he was careful he'd be able to keep track of everything going on without Cerise noticing him. All that he had to do now was pray that Jack would hold up his end of the deal.

The door frame groaned a little bit as he leaned on it, and Johnny made a note not to press his full weight on it. Pressing his ear gently against the door frame, he began eavesdropping...

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------

Jack threw open the door to the shed, and took in the sight of Cerise Jones, her dark skin glistening in the sunlight. She was a tall (taller than his current body, Jack noted) girl so Jack had to angle his head up a bit to meet her eyes. He straightened his back. Just because he was in the body of a dork doesn't mean he needed to act like one.

"Hello Cerise!" He said. He puffed his chest out, and while it was nothing compared to his old body, it did wonders to make him look less pathetic. Cerise eyed him strangely. "Thank you for coming."

"Is your brother Jack here?" She asked, craning her neck to look around the shack. "I thought I heard him."

<i>If only you knew...</i> Jack thought to himself. "No, Jack's not here. He's way too busy to hang out with a dweeb like me."

"But you said–"

"I say a lot of things." Jack said, cutting her off. "I thought you'd be able to test the machine with him but he had to head out. It's just gonna be you and me today. I hope that's not a problem." He met her eyes as he said this, and she was taken aback by the unflinching eye contact from someone who was usually so shy.

"Are you all right Johnny?" Cerise asked. Johnny looked off somehow, though not necessarily in a bad way. Everyone in town knew that an invitation to the Mack residency usually lead to trouble and it crossed her mind briefly that perhaps Johnny had invented some kind of cloning device and this was some kind of evil twin situation, but the idea was absurd even for Johnny. "You seem... different, today."

Jack resisted the urge to roll his eyes. "Well Cerise, how am I usually?"

"I-" She paused, unsure of how to answer the question. "I don't know really."

"Well," Jack replied, gesturing for Cerise to enter the shack. "Let's get to know each other a little better."
14411332.title: The backyard

144113321.content:
A little bit later…

Cerise was currently strapped into Johnny’s machine, studying him as he fiddled with his mind reading device. He had spent the last half-hour babbling on about the machine to her and while she didn’t understand most of it, she found herself strangely captivated. She and Johnny had talked a bit about things other than his inventions and she’d found herself laughing and hanging off of his words; turns out he wasn’t just smart, he was funny. Charming. Something about the gentle, yet forceful way he had helped her into the device intrigued her. It was so… un-Johnny-like. Normally he was a nervous wreck but something about this cool confidence he had today was messing with her head. The Johnny she was used to mumbled and shrank into himself when she was around, but today he was bold and confident and it was messing with her head.

She had never paid him much mind, but now that he wasn’t hiding his face she could get a good look and him and had never noticed it before but Johnny did resemble his brother a little bit. Obviously Jack was taller, handsomer, and built like an athlete, but they were brothers and as Cerise stared at him the similarities grew more pronounced. The same sandy colored hair, the same nose, and every now and then as he turned his head and the light caught him just right she saw a glimpse of what she found so appealing in his more conventionally attractive brother.

Meanwhile, as Jack pressed random buttons on the computer, pretending he knew how to work it, he thought about the situation. He’d decided to go above and beyond the call of duty for his little brother and do a bit of flirting with Cerise, trying to do the groundwork for them to maybe get a little bit closer once they were back in their real bodies. Jack had met plenty of girls like Cerise in high school and in college, gorgeous girls who had developed icy exteriors, and he knew exactly how to defrost them. But Cerise had been very receptive to (what she thought was) Johnny’s flirtations. Once they’d warmed up to each other a little bit she’d really surprised him with her attitude and sense of humor. Perhaps there was a bit more to her than she let on, maybe she and Johnny WOULD be a good match for each other. Chalk one up for the dweeb. He glanced up from the computer.

“You’re staring at me.” Jack said, breaking the silence.

“Huh?” Cerise was shaken out of her thoughts and she realized that she had indeed been staring. She thanked her parents for blessing her with dark skin, which helped to hide the blush that she felt rise in her cheeks.

“What are you thinking?” He asked nonchalantly. <i>The Jack Mack Charm™ is irresistible.</i>

She smiled coyly at him. “Isn’t your machine supposed to tell you?”

“A man can never really tell what a woman is thinking.” Jack fired back, meeting her eyes and giving her a lopsided smile in return. <i>Ugh, this is so corny</i> he thought to himself. “But it looks like the machine isn’t working anyways. You know how it is with these crazy inventions, sometimes I get so far into my own head I just end up going absolutely crazy.”

“You don’t have to tell me that. I still haven’t fully forgiven you for the flowers you gave me!” She teased, reminding him of the ill-conceived flowers he'd once planted in her locker.

<i>Flowers?</i> Jack thought to himself. Probably one of Johnny’s screw ups, it was getting hard to keep count. Cerise noticed his brow furrow and mistook it for a look of disappointment, and took pity on him.

“At least it wasn’t a fiasco like the flying ice cream machine was.” She offered. Both of them shuddered. Everyone in town remembered the flying ice cream machine.

“Yup, at least it wasn’t that! Sorry about the… the flowers thing, by the way. I’m getting a bit too old for this ‘teen genius’ thing.” Jack said. “I’m thinking it’s time I grew up a bit, got out of this shack and took an interest in… more mature pursuits.” He added a bit of suggestiveness to this last statement, but looked innocently up at the ceiling as he said it.

“Really?” Cerise gasped, not even bothering to hide her shock. “I never thought I’d hear Johnny Mack, inventor whiz kid, say that.”

“I’m serious,” Jack said, raising his voice a bit to make sure Johnny could hear them in the backyard. “Maybe my brother Jack is right. Maybe if I got out of this lab more and stopped acting like such a total freakazoid I could have a chance with a pretty girl like you.”

Cerise was further shocked. Not about the pretty thing (she knew she was pretty, she owned a mirror) but about the rest of it. Johnny opening up to her like this was so unexpected but… Maybe, in a weird sort of way his mind reading machine had worked, because she found herself speaking her mind in a way she didn’t usually.

“Okay, so, I don’t want you getting the wrong idea from this,” she began. “But you’ve been super cool to me this afternoon and I feel comfortable right now and I swear if you tell ANYONE at school that I said this I’ll 100% deny it but… don’t give up on your inventions.”

“What?” Jack was taken aback. Of all the things Cerise could have said, he hadn’t been expecting that.

“Yeah. I mean, obviously they’re crazy and always cause a shit-ton of trouble,” Cerise said. “But I have a bit of a soft spot for them. I mean, I think it’s super cool that you do them. I wish I was half as smart as you are, and even if I was I don’t think I could do the things you do. Like, how many guys our age want to do something with their lives and change the world like you do? You’re…” she hesitated for a moment, before mumbling out this final part. “You’re kind of a cool dude Johnny.”

It was Jack’s turn to be shocked. He was embarrassed to admit he’d never thought of his brother’s exploits like that; they had always just been a nuisance to him rather than, as he now realized, something that made his brother happy. Cerise was perceptive and although she tried to pretend like she didn’t, she must care about his brother a lot. A strange silence hung in the air after she finished speaking as both of them thought about what had been said.
144113321.title: Things go well

1441133212.content:
In the backyard, Johnny was struggling to get comfortable. His new body was causing him more problems than he'd anticipated, he was carrying a lot more mass than he was used to and he kept accidentally bumping into the shack because he forgot how broad his shoulders were. He was too heavy to lean on the door frame (he'd never realized how flimsy his lab was, it really was just a shack) so Johnny had ended up seated on the ground, which he also struggled to make comfortable. Genetics and a dedicated squat routine had given Jack something of a bubble butt so Johnny wasn't exactly lacking padding, but those same genetics had given Johnny another problem.

Johnny shifted again, splaying his legs out wide in front of him to make room for his new genitals. Sighing, Johnny stared down at the offending bulge in his shorts. He poked it. Johnny didn't like to think about his body much but he considered his manhood to be average (okay... below average, but not by too much) and it never gave him problems like this. Jack's privates were annoyingly <i>present</i>, and it was distracting Johnny. As if he didn't already have an inferiority complex, he didn't need to know that his brother was hung as well. It was hard to believe that he and Jack were in the same family! It was like Jack had taken all of the big dick genes in the womb and left Johnny with the scraps.

He shouldn't be too ungrateful of course, his intellect was his gift much like Jack's body was his. But having spent a bit of time in Jack's body, jealousy seemed like the natural reaction. He couldn't help himself; he flexed his arm again, watching the huge bicep inflate. Lifting both arms he struck an exaggerated double bicep pose, like a body builder. No wonder Jack worked out so much, he felt like a super hero. He ran his hands over Jack's body, surveying each muscle he found. It was a bit odd to be feeling up his brother like this, but he chose to think of it in a more academic sense. This was his once in a lifetime opportunity to examine the male body at peak physical performance from the inside, a bold extension of his experiment.

The conclusion? Being ripped was fucking awesome. He ran his hands over his abs (because he had abs!) and grinned like a little kid. Of all of his failed experiments this was definitely turning out to be the most fun.

Suddenly a shadow fell over him. Johnny looked up, squinting in the sun, and saw...
1441133212.title: Johnny has a hard time.

14411332123.content:
Johnny looked up to see an Asian guy who looked to be around Jack's age, sporting a blue t-shirt and some shorts. He was very tall but didn't seem very threatening; he had a big dopey grin on his face and eyes that seemed kind, but perhaps not the brightest. He was staring down at Johnny with amusement.

"You uh, you having fun there dude?" He asked. Johnny became acutely aware of where his hands were placed (he had frozen with one around his thigh and the other slipped under his shirt groping one of his pecs) and scrambled to his feet. He awkwardly flailed his hands around as his brain short circuited trying to remember where normal human beings usually kept their hands.

"Yeah–I was just–I mean–" He stammered before finally blurting out "Who are you exactly?"

The man rolled his eyes. "Ha ha, very funny dude. Sorry for dropping by unannounced, I'll give you a heads up next time so I don't interrupt one of your make out sessions with yourself." Johnny blushed and looked down at the grass. The man chuckled and gave Johnny a playful punch to the shoulder. "Hey, if I looked like you did I'd probably spend all day touching myself too."

Johny stared awkwardly at the man in front of him, who he had figured out by now was probably one of Jack's friends. "Did you... did you like need something?"

Jack's friend smiled widely at Johnny. "That's Jack, always straight to the point. I was on my way to the park when I noticed your car parked outside and figured I'd drop in. Back gate still works like it used to when we were kids." The dude paused to look around the backyard. "Man, it's been ages since I've been back here. Your brother still do weird science shit in the shack?" He asked, moving towards the window.

Panicked, Johnny grabbed the man before he could get into the sideline of the window. This dude seemed to be in shape but he was nothing compared to Jack, and with his new muscles Johnny fond it easy to maneuver him back towards the fence.

"Actually Johnny's working on something in there right now, it's REALLY important that we don't bother him." Johnny didn't stop pushing him as he said this, continuously ushering Jack's friend towards the gate he came in through and away from potential embarrassment.

"Oh shit that's perfect!" The dude slipped out of Johnny's grasp and wheeled around to face him. "You wanna come with me to the park? Arnie's gonna be there, we were gonna play basketball with some of the other guys. You gotta come, it's been ages since we all balled." Johnny had made it a point to avoid Jack's friends, but this guy seemed friendly enough. Almost too friendly, Johnny had never met someone who smiled as much as this guy did. As if to prove his point, Jack's friend's smile widened even more.

"What do you say man?"

Johnny opened his mouth to shoot the man down, but then paused. Wasn't this the perfect opportunity to get to know Jack better? Wasn't that the whole point of the machine to begin with? An afternoon as a hotshot jock playing basketball with the boys was a once in a lifetime opportunity. Jack always said he wanted Johnny to get out of the lab and socialize, so really, this was exactly what he wanted.

Plus he was getting antsy sitting here. He'd always found it a bit obnoxious how Jack would randomly begin stretching or doing some kind of minor exercise thing when he was trying to talk to him, but he understood it now. Jack's body was brimming with energy, it wasn't meant to be sitting around cramped up like this. After spending the last half hour feeling up his borrowed muscles he wanted to take them for a test drive.

But on the other hand, he wasn't confident leaving. Although things seemed to be going well between Jack and Cerise, Johnny didn't know if he could trust Jack not to screw this up. By leaving he risked pissing Jack off, which could backfire horribly. And something else to consider was that he still didn't know if there would be any side effects to the machine yet, so it might be best to stay close.

What would he do?
14411332123.title: Someone else

144113321231.content:
Staying here and freaking out about the situation wasn't going to help anyone, so Johnny decided to have a little fun. He'd consider it payback for all of the times Jack had bailed on him to hang out with his friends; after all, wasn't he Jack right now?

"The park sounds like a lot of fun," Johnny said. "I could do with a bit of exercise, this body isn't meant to be stagnant for extended periods."

"Huh?" The dude gave him a blank stare, not registering what Johnny had just said. Johnny resisted the urge to roll his eyes. The words weren't even that big?

"Oh, I mean, sounds cool." Johnny said, and the guy seemed to understand that. "Just one second." He pulled out his phone (or rather Jack's phone, they hadn't thought to swap) and shot off a quick text to Jack.

Hey Jack, one of your friends showed up at the house (tall dude, Asian, seems "happy") and he's making me go to the park with him. Will try to get back ASAP, wait for me.

Don't forget, if you mess things up with Cerise, neck tattoo.

He looked up and saw Jack's friend staring at him with another perplexed expression. Did this guy only have two faces? Johnny raised an eyebrow.

"You type fast." The guy said.

"Uh, yeah. Let's go–" Johnny paused, unsure of what to call this guy. What would Jack say? "...bro." The word felt unfamiliar in his mouth, he nearly cringed as he said it, but it seemed to satisfy the man. He followed his "bro" out of the backyard.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------

One of the advantages of living in the suburbs was that you were never far from a park, so the walk over there was relatively brisk. (And, as Johnny thought about it, it was probably faster because he and his companion were both very tall.) Johnny got to know Jack's friend on the way, he still didn't know his name but he was starting to piece together who this guy was. He kept mentioning people whose names Johnny vaguely recognized from growing up, so he must have known Jack for a long time. The dude clearly wasn't the sharpest tool in the shed but he seemed to have a LOT of opinions on professional sports and people that Johnny didn't know, leaving Johnny feeling like the stupid one at times. Eventually the topic turned to superhero movies, a topic both of them could agree on, and the conversation flowed more naturally from there.

In his mind Johnny had built up his brother's friends to be uniformly pigheaded jocks, and while there was some truth to that (at one point Johnny had mentioned that Metamorpho from The Outsiders had the power of "transfiguration" at one point and the dude had responded that he supported all genders) Johnny was actually getting along really well with this guy. He was so infectiously cheerful that Johnny found himself laughing along even when he didn't understand what he was saying (he suspected the opposite was also true) and he arrived at the park in a very good mood.

The two headed to the basketball court where several men around Jack's age were playing basketball. A guy was seated on the benches beside the court; he had his headphones in and wasn't really paying attention to the game.

"Yooooo, Arnie!" Johnny started as his companion suddenly bellowed. The guy on the bench lifted his head from his phone and nodded towards the two of them.

"Hey Damien! Didn't realize you were bringing Jack." He greeted them, grabbing a basketball and jogging over to the tree they stood beside. Johnny sighed with relief, at least he knew his new friend's name! This must Arnie, the guy Jack's friend (Damien, Johnny now guessed) had mentioned earlier.

Johnny looked the guy up and down: he was shorter than both of them, probably around the same height that Johnny was in his old body. He was a slender fellow who seemed less athletic than the people Jack usually hung around with, with long brown hair pulled back into a ponytail behind him. His brown eyes were awake and alert behind his glasses as they darted between Jack and Damien.

"Hi Arnie." He said to the newcomer. Arnie looked at him puzzled for a second, but before he could say anything Damien cut him off.

"Yo Arnie, help me and Jack decide something: Static Shock versus Black Lightning, who wins?" Damien said, continuing the argument he and Johnny had begun on the way over.

"Why would they fight?" Arnie said with a lopsided grin. "They're in love."

Johnny snorted and Damien's brow furrowed. "But-"

"Oh my god it was a joke." Arnie said, rolling his eyes. He made eye contact with Johnny in a "can you believe this guy?" kind of way before continuing on. "But seriously, it depends. Black Lightning has more firepower but Static has more versatility. Depends who gets the first shot."

"That's exactly what I said!" Johnny exclaimed. "See Damien, this guy gets it." He turned to Arnie excitedly, ready to nerd out. "I suppose it also depends on the canon we're talking about, because if we're referring to the original Bronze Age interpretation wherein he derives his powers from his belt rather than latent metahuman genes, then–"

The streets of Snoozeton whizzed by in the bright afternoon light and for a moment all of them were as calm as they had been when they'd woken up that morning in their own bodies.

"Hey, we were just teasing by the way." Cerise said finally. She looked back at Jack sympathetically, and his face softened. He relaxed into a more natural sitting position, though Cerise grimaced when she saw how he splayed her body's legs out like a dude.

"Being Arnold isn't be so bad though." Damien said. He idly ran his fingers through Arnold's long hair, feeling disconnected from the movement almost as if he weren't doing it. Perhaps it was a subconscious motion, or something in his body's muscle memory, but the feeling soothed him.

"About that..." Cerise saw an opening to broach a question that had been on her mind. "What's the deal with this Arnold guy?"

"What do you mean?" Damien asked.

"I mean, I've never met the guy. What's he like? What's up with the disappearing act he pulled with Jack's body?"

"Oh Arnie's the coolest," Damien grinned and leaned back in his seat. "He's this super smart dude, super funny, kind of a nerd but we've been friends since forever. Since like third grade, I think."

"That long? Damn..." Jack breathed.

"Well, I met him in third grade. I think we met you in middle school? Right? Yeah, we met you in middle school." Damien's brow furrowed as he tried to remember. "Oh dude, it's all coming back to me. I accidentally kicked a ball into his head during recess and I felt so bad I hung out with him for the rest of the day and we ended up becoming bros. We used to color together. And then we started hanging out with Jack in middle school because we all sat at the back table because the other kids didn't like how Jack smelled."

Cerise eyed Jack curiously and he flushed a shade darker. "I was a kid, okay? It was middle school, nobody's cool in middle school."

"Of course this was before Jack and I got all tall and ripped and shit," Damien winked at Cerise and flexed a bicep that wasn't currently there. "Once we hit puberty we started going out to parties and dates and stuff. That wasn't really Arnie's scene but we still stayed super close even in college. The three of us used to get into so much trouble together!"

"We did, didn't we?" Jack said, grinning as he thought of their past exploits. "We were always sneaking out, going places we weren't supposed to, pulling pranks, it was legendary. I thought his head was going to explode every time we did something illegal but he always tagged along."

"Sounds like you guys were close. So what changed?" Cerise asked.

"Nothing's changed!" Damien said cheerfully. "I mean, Jack transferred out of community college to that fancier school and then got that new job so we don't get to see him as much but we're all still friends. That's the cool thing about Arnie, I can always talk to him and it's like we're still teenagers."

"You're too nice," Jack said. "Especially when it comes to Arnold."

Damien frowned. "What's that mean?

"I mean Arnold's always been..." Jack paused for a moment, mulling over his words as if trying to chose the most polite ones. "kind of a weirdo. Not a total freak or anything but he's just awkward around people. He says things that make people uncomfortable and I don't know if he even knows that he's doing it. Like, I was sitting at the back table in middle school because I hadn't discovered deodorant yet. Arnold sat back there because that's where the weird kids sat."

"Hey! I'm normal and I was back there too." Damien exclaimed defensively.

"That's because you were sitting with him." Jack said blankly.

"Oh, huh." Damien shrank a little bit, and Cerise patted him on the shoulder sympathetically.

"Anyways," Jack continued. "Me, Damien and him, we were always good friends when we were younger and but somewhere along the way... I dunno, shit got weird with him. Don't get me wrong, he's always been a good friend to us but like, I always kind of thought that he was maybe jealous of me or something."

"What? Why would he be jealous of you?" Damien scoffed. "He's way cooler then you."

"I mean," Jack puffed up slightly, which would have been impressive in his old body but in Cerise's body it meant he pushed her breasts out a little bit. "I don't wanna brag but I'm kind of a stud. When we hit high school and I started working out and bagging all the chicks I think that started to Arnold want what I had and it messed with our dynamic. I mean, you've got his body right now. Check it out and tell me that it's nicer than mine."

"His body is fine, bro." Damien snapped. To further prove his point he gave himself an awkward hug, feeling his hands settle strangely around Arnold's bony ribs.

"Well apparently he disagreed because he decided to take mine and hightail it out of here," Jack sighed and looked at Damien sympathetically. He knew how close Damien was to Arnold and he didn't want to offend his friend, but Damien really had a blind spot when it came to Arnold and even now he couldn't acknowledge what mess their friend had caused. "But he's our friend and I'll give him the benefit of the doubt. Maybe we'll laugh about this some day but we have to fix this first."

"He has seemed a bit... moodier since we graduated." Damien conceded. He pouted and turned his head to stare out the window, and realized that they were pulling into the parking lot of his apartment complex. "I couldn't figure out why."

"Well you can ask him when you find him." Cerise said. "We're here."

"Yeah, thanks for the ride Cerise. You're a pretty cool chick," He paused. "Or dude I guess."

"Thanks. Hey, find your friend so we can fix this, okay?" She patted him on the shoulder and he nodded at her and stepped out of the car. Cerise gestured for Jack to stay. "Head inside, I want to talk to Jack for a second."

Damien complied and Jack sat in the backseat confused for a moment. Cerise unbuckled her seatbelt and craned her body awkwardly around the car seat so she could glare at Jack in the back. It would have been easy in her old body but she puffed unattractively as she felt Johnny's belly press into the seat. Still she managed to get into Jack's face and glower at him.

"Look, I don't know what kind of spiderweb of personal issues I just walked into, but you need to fix it, okay?" Jack was taken aback by the intensity in her voice, especially since he had never seen his little brother look this determined before. He nodded meekly. "Good, because I've known that boy for like, an hour now and I already like him more than you so don't screw this up." She motioned with her head for him to get out of her car. "And remember, respect my body or I'll make your life hell."

Jack sighed as he watched Cerise drive off. He'd been pushed around more today than he had been in years. "Yet another reason for me to want my body back" he mused. He turned and walked towards Damien's apartment.

14411332123131211122211111.content:
Damien had been adamant about moving away from home after college, and was proud of himself for being on his own even if "away from home" had ended up being a three room apartment in a two story building just a few miles from his family's house. He loved his family but he'd insisted that a growing boy needed his space, and besides, since he worked for their landscaping company he couldn't move that far away anyways.

Apartment buildings weren't exactly a common sight in Snoozeton where real estate prices meant most people either lived in a house or one of the nearby cities, but the complex was located near the heart of town, well-maintained, and affordable enough that Damien didn't need a roommate. The building was set up similarly to a motel, with each room being connected by an outdoor walkway, and Damien's apartment was on the second floor.

Jack pounded up the stairs somewhat awkwardly he found himself stumbling over the stairs several times. Cerise was shorter than his real body was but her proportions were different and it threw Jack off. She was a girl with gorgeously long limbs that Jack had absolutely no clue how to handle. Cerise's body looked somewhat strange while he was in control because he walked like he was still a jock rather than a cheerleader, stomping his feet flat on the ground and giving a wide gait to leave room for something that wasn't currently there between his legs.

And there were other factors to consider... Jack gave an exasperated sigh as he grabbed his breasts to keep them from bouncing everywhere as he ascended the steps. He definitely liked boobs but the fact that these were his and he had no choice about it was killing the fun. He'd certainly enjoyed them earlier when they were on the floor of the shack and he just had to play with them but in motion they felt like a bit much. He grimaced after another stumble caused him to grip one too hard.

Cerise had gotten dressed for fashion, not for function, and as his shorts rode up and his tits bounced Jack felt uncomfortably exposed. Jack would have to see if he could borrow a jacket from Damien or something because there was no way he was going to spend all day feeling half-naked. He was no stranger to showing some skin (in his old body he took great pleasure in showing off his finely toned muscles) but this felt different in a bad way.

-----

One of Damien's neighbors was sitting in a lawn chair on the walkway, smoking a cigarette and staring out over the scenic parking lot view. He was enjoying a moment of silence on a lovely summer afternoon when he heard someone clomping up the stairs, and turned his head to see a gorgeous black girl emerge from the stairwell clutching her chest. He stared at her as she walked down the hallway towards him, her strange manner doing nothing to dissuade his leering glances. He whistled at her, and she stopped, staring at him with confusion.

"Hey baby," he called out to her, his voice dripping with sleaze. "What's a beautiful girl like you doing here all alone?"

It took Jack a second to realize what was happening. Was this guy... hitting on him? Jack took a second to survey the man. He was a hairy looking dude, one of those guys who's nearly thirty but insists on acting like he's still a frat boy, someone Jack would categorize him as "harmless." A loser. Cerise was way out of his league anyways, so Jack just rolled his eyes and kept on walking.

"Hey, I asked you a question!" The man rose from his chair and placed one arm out to lean on the railing, effectively blocking the walkway and keeping Jack from continuing. Jack sighed. He'd met plenty of guys like this while he was in college, men who were past their prime and couldn't get girls anymore so they just came across as desperate and creepy. Jack crossed his arms and tried to look as tall as possible.

"I'm going to my friend's apartment." He said, hoping that the guy would take the hint. "It's right over there." He stepped to the left to get around the man and the man stepped to remain in his way. Jack frowned. Didn't this guy see he wasn't interested?

"I can be your friend." The guy was clearly trying to be charming but something about the way that the man said it made Jack's skin crawl. He was leaning into Jack's personal space, his breath warm and sticky, and in spite of himself Jack stepped back a bit.

"Dude, step off, I'm not interested." He pushed the guy's chest, which unfortunately accomplished nothing. It finally registered for Jack just how much bigger and heavier this man was than his current body, and he didn't like it one bit. He wasn't used to being the smaller, weaker one in the situation. The man reached out and stroked Cerise's hair, and Jack felt dirty where the man's fingers brushed his skin. He slapped the hand away. "Don't touch me!"

"I'm just being friendly." The guy said. His eyes flicked down to stare at Cerise's breasts and he licked his lips, making Jack feel even more exposed.

"I said sit your ass back down in that chair before I kick your ass!" He burst out. The man looked shocked for a second, then began laughing.

"Alright, I can take a hint. Damn, chicks like you can be so sensitive." The man sneered at him and finally sat back down in his seat, reaching down to take a swig of a beer that sat beside the chair. "Call me when you aren't on your period."

Jack bit his tongue and refused to ask what the guy meant by any of that. Drawing his head up high, he fixed his eyes on Damien's apartment and began walking towards it, but a second after he passed by the man he felt a hand smack his ass. Jack froze for a second, then he snapped. He whirled around to face the man and leaned down to grab the collar of his shirt, staring him dead in his eyes with what (he hoped) was a fearsome expression. "I said don't fucking touch me!" he snarled. The man looked confused, but some small note of fear managed to penetrate his face.

"Alright, fine. Didn't wanna touch your ugly ass anyways." The man took another drag of his cigarette and blew it in Jack's face. The smoke stung Jack's eyes and he coughed, releasing the man's shirt. The man in the chair laughed at him. "Crazy bitch..." he muttered under his breath.

Jack felt his heart rate rise but chose to keep walking. He had never been one to run from a fight and he wanted to clobber this man but if he tried it right now he'd probably just get Cerise's body beaten up, or worse. Jack shut down that line of thinking before it could go any further. If only he were in his real body, then he could teach this guy a lesson. He didn't realize just how much he relied on his bulk and size to navigate the world. When a guy challenged him he was sure he could win if it came down to a fight, and sure he got harassed by girls sometimes but even getting perved on by someone like Darlene was more of an annoyance than anything else. It never felt dangerous or humiliating like what he had just experienced.

Damien had left the door of his apartment hanging open for him and Jack didn't begin to calm down until it was firmly shut behind him.

144113321231312111222111111.content:
Jack surveyed the apartment as he stepped into it. It was a simple place, the front door opened right into the living room/kitchenette and to the left there was a hallway leading to a few other rooms. He’d been over here a few times before for parties but without the throngs of people inside it he noticed how empty it was. Even though Damien had lived here for over a year now the apartment was still fairly bare and spartan, as if he hadn't quite settled in or figured out that this space was his to fill.

There was a couch and coffee table placed in front of a television (with several game consoles hooked up to it, of course), a folding table with some chairs located vaguely near the kitchen area, and a third table covered in junk sitting against another wall, but that was it. The only thing that seemed maybe out of place was a novelty vase shaped like the Superman logo that sat on the counter of the messy kitchenette. It was full of flowers that, upon closer inspection, were all plastic. Jack glanced down the hallway that lead to the other rooms and saw that all of the doors were closed.

“You in here?” He called out, and a toilet flushed in response.

“Yeah bro, just a sec.” Damien called from the bathroom. He emerged from it a moment later and joined Jack in the living room, shaking some excess moisture from his hands. His face was damp as if he’d just splashed water on it, and Arnold’s shaggy bangs were matted onto his forehead. He smiled at Jack, evidently not noticing if anything was wrong with him. “What’d Cerise want?”

“Uh, nothing,” Jack replied awkwardly. There was no real reason for him to lie about what had just happened (either Cerise’s warning or the neighbor’s harassment) but he was determined not to show weakness, or to seem like he couldn’t handle this crazy situation. “She just wanted to be sure I wasn’t gonna do anything creepy with her body.”

Damien quirked an eyebrow at him. “Are you?”

“What? No!” Jack exclaimed. He flushed a shade darker. “Why does everyone keep assuming that?”

“Dude, I’ve known you for years now and you’re a total horndog,” Damien walked over to the fridge as he said this, and began rifling through its contents. Jack glimpsed over his shoulder and saw more fruits and vegetables than he expected, and a surprising number of eggs. “You talk a good talk but I’d bet you’re feeling her tits every second someone’s not looking at you.”

“Yeah, well, being a chick isn’t all fun and games,” Jack said, shuddering internally as he thought of what had happened just outside that door. Damien shrugged and fished two beers out of the fridge.

“Want one?” He offered, holding out a bottle to Jack. Jack stared at the beverage.

“Shouldn’t we be out looking?” He asked expectantly. He didn't want to spend any more time in this body than he had to, at least without knowing his real one was secure and waiting for his return.

“The world’s not gonna end if we sit for ten minutes,” Damien replied, already removing the cap from his bottle with a bottle opener attached to his keys. “We’ll search better if we’re rested.”

After a moment’s hesitation, Jack took the bottle. He was feeling stressed out, and it would help to have something to take the edge off. Damien threw himself down onto the couch and sprawled out across it, a tangle of gangly limbs. Jack shoved his legs off the couch and sat down next to him in the vacant space. The two of them sighed and sat in silence for a moment.

“How crazy is this whole thing, huh?” Damien asked. “Body switching? Your brother is a total mad scientist.”

“And a total screwup,” Jack grumbled. “Once again, he messed up and everybody else deals with the consequences.”

“Well he’s lucky he’s got you for a brother then,” Damien said without a hint of irony. “so he knows he’s got someone tough looking out for him.”

He smiled that dumb, good natured smile of his and Jack could swear he felt his teeth rotting from how sweet it was. Damien could be dumb sometimes, but maybe he had a point and his words hit home a little bit. Even though he was practically an adult Johnny was still Jack’s little kid brother, and it was his duty to protect him. Jack wasn’t sure what to say, so instead he took a swig of his beer. Unexpectedly the liquid tasted foul as it entered his mouth and in surprise he almost choked on it. Damien stared at him sputtering with concern, and when he was done coughing Jack grimaced.

“Shit, I don’t think this body likes beer.” Jack said. He got up, rushed to the kitchen, and began washing his mouth out in the sink. When the sounds of the faucet died away he heard someone laughing and it took him a moment to realize that it was Damien; Arnold seldom laughed like that so the sound was completely foreign to Jack’s ears. Jack took a moment to examine Damien from across the room.

Arnold was a skinny guy, all angles and bones, and while he wasn't ugly he had an air of suspicion about him that was a little alienating. He was always hunched over as if on the defensive, and people could always see the wheels turning behind his eyes as he overanalyzed every situation. But with Damien in control his body looked almost completely different. All of the tension was gone and he lay there relaxed and exposed, lean limbs spilling across the couch rather than hunched in to take up as little room as possible, a big guy trapped in a little body. Damien’s inner light even seemed to give Arnold’s pale skin a glow and Jack suspected that Damien was the type of guy who could wear anyone’s body and make it work for him. But something about his wide smile still looked foreign on Arnold’s narrow features, something about his bright eyes didn't seem to sit right behind Arnold's glasses. Damien caught Jack staring at him and his giggles died out.

“Why are you looking at me like that dude?” He asked suspiciously.

“It’s just weird to see Arnold act like you. Like, smiling and shit,” Jack said, plopping himself back onto the couch with a glass of water in hand. “It’s like he’s been replaced by an alien who’s not a total stick in the mud.”

“Hey!” Damien shoved Jack playfully. “I’m gonna take that as you complimenting how awesome I am instead of you insulting my best bro. Arnie’s plenty of fun, just like, a different kind of fun. Besides, if you think this is weird, imagine looking at the legendary stud of Snoozeton Jack Mack and seeing a girl. A girl who can’t even drink! Now that’s freaky.”

“Even as a girl I’m still more of a man then you’ll ever be,” Jack teased, using his legs to shove at Damien’s playfully. He was definitely more relaxed now, and feeling a bit more comfortable in Cerise’s body. “I bet I could still bag ten times as many chicks as you. And they’d be lesbians too, so they’d be into the freaky shit.” Jack wiggled his eyebrows and made some suggestive hand motions that didn't seem to relate to any known sex acts, which Damien caused to snort and roll his eyes. He took a swig of his beer and then looked over at Jack.

“Seriously man, you play with them?” Damien asked, nodding his head and flicking his eyes down to indicate Cerise’s breasts. Jack sorely wished that she’d picked a less revealing top to wear the day she decided to get switched into his body. “I’m not gonna judge, I know I’d do it.”

“Honestly man? Yeah, a few times.” Jack glanced down at his breasts and gave one of them a poke. It always seemed to come back to these, didn’t it? He’d already gotten an up close and personal view of Cerise’s body from the inside AND out earlier, and playing with certain parts of her was really fun, but touching her when she wasn’t in the room and consenting to it felt a little bit icky. “I feel a little weird about it but like… I’m still a guy inside and they’re always there.”

“Nice…” Damien said, slouching down into the couch and spreading his legs out. He took another sip of his beer then looked over at Jack with a glint in his eye. “What about the… you know…”

“What?” Jack asked exasperatedly.

“The–“ Damien leaned in close and whispered. “–lady parts.”

“Dude, what are you, twelve?” Jack placed his hands on Damien’s face and shoved him back. “I’m not answering that.”

“Come on, how can you not?” Damien broke out into a shit-eating grin. “It’s like, the holy grail and it’s right there.”

“Are you gonna play around with Arnold’s dick then?” Jack fired back. Damien flinched and his pale skin blossomed beet red.

“Gross dude, he’s my friend!” He crossed his arms and looked across the room and sorely wished he’d put up more decorations so he’d have something to stare at. He'd been avoiding touching that particular topic, or, for that matter, that particular part.

“See? Now you get how weird this whole body switching thing is,” Jack shook his head and patted his sulking friend on the shoulder then joined him in staring at nothing in particular. “Unless we solve this we’re gonna have to get intimate with these bodies eventually.”

Damien seemed to mull this thought over for a moment, then turned to Jack and said-

“Alright then, that’s enough relaxing. Let’s make a game plan.” Damien reached under the table and pulled out a notepad that looked like it came from some long forgotten board game. Flipping past several drawings of dicks he finally found a blank page upon which he wrote the word “Game Plan” in sloppy letters at the top. He underlined these words a few times and drew a happy face next to it. Smiling with satisfaction, he leaned back into the couch and looked at Jack expectantly. “Where should we start?”

“Uh…” Jack began wracking his brain, but was drawing up blanks. It wasn’t like they could search up “how to find someone who stole your body” on the internet or report it to the police, and as much as he didn’t like to admit it he didn’t know Arnold well enough to even begin to guess what he was doing out there with his body. "I'll be honest, I'm drawing a blank here. Arnold and I don't really hang out that much solo and I haven't seen you guys in a while so I don't really know what he's in to these days."

"Oh that reminds me, we should totally hang out more when this is over," Damien said, and he looked at Jack with a bit of a mournful look in his eyes. "I know we still see each other every now and then but I miss you man, and I think Arnie does too. We've got a lot of history man, I don't wanna lose you."

Jack winced. He ran in slightly different social circles these days and he had to admit he'd fallen out of touch with a few of his old friends. "Sorry about that. It's just, you know, I got so busy with school, and now with work..." Shit, he hadn't even considered work. He wasn't needed at the office for a few days but if they didn't get this fixed soon he'd have to figure out what he was going to tell them. Would they let him keep doing his job with a different body? He blinked and realized he'd completely been ignoring Damien. "You know how it is with growing up."

"You don't outgrow friends dude." Damien said, and he sounded completely genuine.

"Uh, yeah you do? That's like, rule number one of life." Jack scratched his head. "Everybody talks about it constantly."

Damien gave Jack a knowing smile. "Not if they're real friends."

"You sound like a fortune cookie, asshole." Jack rolled his eyes but found himself smiling back. "Don't get distracted, we need to focus on finding Arnold! You know him way better than I do. If you were in his shoes–" he paused for a second and smirked. "–which I guess you technically are, where would you go?"

"Well, Arnie usually just kind of hangs out at his apartment. He like, reads and plays games and stuff. So I guess we could check there.“ Damien scribbled “Arnie’s place” down onto the notepad.

“I don’t think he’d run off with my body and then waste it just gaming,“ Jack said. "Where does he go when he's not sitting on his ass at home?"

“Well, most of the time I see him he’s over here hanging out with me,” Damien wrote “my place” on the list and then craned his head to look around the apartment. “And he’s not here right now, so I guess we can cross it off the list.” He scribbled the words he just wrote out and smiled at Jack. “One down already!”

Jack sighed. “Okay, now try thinking of places we aren’t already at.”

"He hangs out at the hobby shop a lot," Damien offered. "He's really into those weird magic card game tournaments and he does that thing where people dress up and have fake fantasy battles. I think he's gotta be pretty tight with the people there, he talks about it a lot."

Horrific images of his body wearing a robe and waving a staff around flashed before Jack's eyes. "I really hope he's not doing that nerd shit with my body, if anyone finds out about it my reputation will be ruined!"

"Nerd stuff went mainstream a while ago bro," Damien said sagely. “I’ve seen like, eight superhero movies this year and people don’t think I’m a nerd. Nobody really cares anymore."

"I care!" Jack exclaimed. "This is some advanced nerd shit. They wear like... tights and stuff, and funny hats. If someone takes a picture or a video of me dressed up dancing around like a fairy and it ends up on the Internet I'll never hear the end of it."

"Okay sure, we can check there first if it'll make you feel better." Damien chuckled at how sensitive Jack was, and wrote “advanced nerd shit” onto the list.

"I don't feel like you're taking this seriously dude." Jack said accusatorially. “My brother has your body and who knows what he’s doing with it, you won’t think this situation is so funny when he presses the wrong button on one of his machines and like, blows you’re eyebrows off or something.”

"I mean, I trust him," Damien said firmly. "Both Arnie and your brother. You just gotta have a little faith man, people are nicer than you give them credit for. And hey, if I don't have eyebrows I'll just draw them on with a sharpie. Same difference."

Jack looked up at the ceiling and sighed. Whenever he was around Damien sighing was just part of his normal breathing pattern. “Anywhere else?”

“Uh, he likes to go to the library. Also the mall, even though he doesn’t really buy stuff he just likes looking in the windows and seeing if there’s anything new. Oh! And he likes walking in the park.” Damien began adding different locations to the list. “And he likes that diner down on Main Street, because they have really good combo options so he can order eggs and get those banana muffins he likes and–“

“Unless his plan was to ruin my abs by eating a bunch of carbs I really don’t think he stole my body so he could eat muffins,” Jack interrupted, though he really hoped that that wasn’t the case because he was pretty fond of his abs and he wanted them back. “I think we’ve got a good list of places to start looking. Where should we head first?”

The glee with which he described his science was endearing, and as boring as it was Jack and Cerise found themselves listening politely to his whole schpiel. 1512.content:
Cheryl sat down, nervously shaking at the ramifications of swapping bodies with a younger guy for a short while. 'Will he really keep my life in check? I hope he doesn't screw anything up.' She worried, thinking of her home and family. "Alright, it's all set up, let's get this going." Johnny declared, starting up the machine. Having run through much of the construction and programming, Johnny was nearly certain the two of them would swap bodies. Although, to be honest, seeing and hearing it all function was as much a boost to his pride than if it actually works. "This won't hurt, right?" Cheryl was concerned once more, and upon not hearing Johnny respond, she grew increasingly doubtful. Expecting it not to work from the get-go, she began fretting over if this mix of machinery built by Johnny would explode or catch fire instead. There's no way she'd want to risk her life to make sure some guy's aspirations are affirmed.

"I- I've changed my mind!" Cheryl yelled, getting up from her seat. "Wait, stop!" Johnny called, grabbing onto her arm and pulling her back. "No! Let me go!" She declared, as the shack resounded louder with it's machinery. "You can't just leave in the middle of the swapping process!" Johnny told her, saying it moreso to see this through. Cheryl kept on pulling back, so Johnny also got up from his seat; she was backing out, so Johnny started to back out too, just to place his arm around her waist in an attempt to push her back in. Slowly, Cheryl managed to overpower him, backing both of them out of the shack just enough so that just their heads were outside. And then the process reached it's climax, then finished.

Finding herself completely uninjured, Cheryl got back in, looking down at herself. "Oh my god, it worked!" She shouted, seeing Johnny's clothes and younger skin, whilst speaking with his voice, too. "Yeah, it actually did...." Johnny replied, looking down at the curvy mature body below him. Cheryl turned to cheerily thank Johnny,"This is great, now I can get that vaca-" But cut her kind words as she see the mess now in play. "What?" Johnny asked, oblivious for he was looking away from Cheryl. "Look at me!" She yelled, frustrated. "Oh my god." He whispered, seeing that the swap wasn't completely done. Above the neck of his original body, and with his male lips on her face, was the head of the angry Cheryl. Feeling up his own face with manicured hands, Johnny felt Cheryl's thicker lips on him, but the contours of his face and short hair were definitely his own. "Oh dear. When you tried to escape, our entire bodies must not have been inside the shack. So as a result, what was left out, in this case most of our heads, wasn't included in the swap." He explained.

"This can't be happening! We can't even assume each others' lives!" Cheryl started crying, so Johnny shushed her down with his mature female voice. "It's alright, we can just get the swap process going again." He assured, followed by multiple loud clangs coming from in the shack. Multiple pieces of the machinery had become busted and fallen to the floor, indicating it was inoperable for now. "Gee, thanks a lot; this is definitely going to help me relax now!" Cheryl sarcastically said, poking Johnny in the chest. "How are you going to fix this?" She asked.

info.brief_description: John just stumbled upon something that's going to shake things up in Snoozeton.
info.description:
It's a sleepy, summer afternoon in Snoozeton, a small town in the heart of the Bible belt. Most of the locals spend their time tending to their yards, going to their kids' soccer and baseball games, and enjoying time at neighborhood cookouts.

...That is, until today. Johnny Mack was a bit of a child prodigy, but also just an all-around tinkerer and creator of things. He was very excited, because today he was unveiling his latest creation... The Swap Shack. The Swap Shack is simple, two people enter, two people come out, but in each other's bodies. Ah yes, the great body swap.

What could possibly go wrong?

Characters
The Mack Clan
Johnny Mack - This 17-year old boy genius resembles a character from Real Genius than he does a high school teenager. Always ready to promote his latest gadgets, Johnny is ready to get the Swap Shack up and running.

Carla Mack - The matriarch of the Mack family, Carla is 44 years old and always trying to reel in her son's shoot-from-the-hip experimentation methods. Carla's spent most of her career as a research director, and the years of take-out and gym avoidance are showing.

Richard Mack - The Mack family father, Richard is 45 years old. He's always encouraged his children to explore the sciences. However, Johnny's string of failed experiments have Richard wondering if his son is destined for greatness in the science community. Richard's strong chin and steely gaze gives him the aura of a John Wayne-type persona, but his love for the sciences and caring ways makes him a wonderful father and husband.

Jack Mack - Johnny's older brother, Jack, is 23 and has a budding career as a civil engineer. He's a bit of a jock, and really like to pick on Johnny for being such a nerd. Jack loves nothing more than to mess around with Johnny's gizmos and bully him around. Johnny thinks that Jack's affliction for bullying stems from when Jack was cut from the local minor league baseball team.

Cindy Lou Mack - Jack's older sister. She's 20 years old and just about to finish her degree at the local university. She's a budding mathematician, and someday wants to use math to save the world! She just doesn't know how yet.

More Macks
Denise Mack - Johnny's Aunt. A lovely woman of 50 years, Denise lives in Snoozeton. She's an effeminate, curvy lady that favors wearing dresses and heels. Her sense of adventure has lead her to always be down for an exciting caper.

Snoozeton residents
Cerise - Johnny's not-so-secret crush. As a fellow student at Snoozeton High, Cerise is familiar with Johnny's antics, but acts somewhat aloof since she is the uber-popular cheer team captain. She's a beautiful girl with an athletic body.

Angela - One of Snoozeton High's loaners. Angela enjoys her black clothes and goth music, and just enjoys being a bit of a wallflower. She's pretty, with dark hair and light skin.

Darlene - Neighbor to the Macks. Darlene is a heavy set, single woman with a big crush on Jack Mack. While well intentioned, Darlene is a bit of a clutz and catastrophes seem to follow her everywhere.

The rest of Snoozeton is at this stories disposal. The Mack family lives in a quiet neighborhood, where dozens of families are available for testing.

So read, enjoy, and please leave your comments and reviews. Hell, add a few chapters and help steer the direction of this tale. Let the brain switching, body swapping madness begin!

Additionally, please note the rating for this item. I reserve the right to request edits or remove material.
